name: Aloft Chicago O'Hare

reviews.text: I really wanted to like this hotel but there were too many quirks that made me think that there's got to be better hotels in the area to check out.
reviews.title: Style over Substance

reviews.text: Loved the look of the lobby, bar and courtyard, but they rented the entire space to private parties both Friday and Saturday night. That was just wrong. There was no where to go except to your room during this time. Other hotels would NOT rent out their entire common area at the expense of their hotel guests!
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.text: Other quirks include combined shampoo and conditioner which seemed cheap, parking cost $ to stay there, free pool table but the sticks were bad, feather quilt on bed but the feathers were all around the edges instead of the middle, no dresser drawers for your clothes, and the maid service couldn't get the cups and coffee refills right. Parking included doing u-turns to get to the front entrance and there was construction going on all around the hotel.

reviews.text: One tip, if you're parking there, park in general parking and you can save $7 a day if you're planning on only going out once every 24 hours. Parking is $20 a day for hotel guests and $13 for general parking on the same garage.

Well, we liked the hotel very much, and I'm sure that in the future there will be streets and completed buildings. But when we were there it was a little like being in the middle of a construction site. I found it kind of interesting watching the activity from my window in the morning. And we were actually able to walk to McCormick & Schmick. Might wait till they finish the roads before we visit again. I'm sure it will be a lovely place very soon...

reviews.text: The was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. When we arrived there was a complimentary half drank water in our room, their were stains on the floor and the lights over our bed were burnt out. The sub-par food was very expensive and the complimentary internet they advertise costs you too. The only amenities this place provided are uncomfortable beds and a TV. Then to top it all off they told us parking was only 20 dollars for they duration of the stay, they ended up charging us 20 dollars a night! I stayed 4 nights and had to pay 80 dollars for parking! We tried arguing it and they told us we were not telling the truth and refused us a manager. I have never had a problem with a hotel before this one.
reviews.title: Awful Hotel

reviews.text: Very nice modern interior in this hotel with a young vibrant feeling. Staff ranged from average to friendly and helpful. Room was clean - a bit smaller than other hotels but still of ample size. Beds were so so. While there is no room service etc. there is a nice lounge and free water bottles / coffee in the rooms, a nice touch. Another bonus is the free internet. This may be the only hotel near Rosemont/airport offering this amenity. Overall was an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Modern, chic and electric

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed here Aug 12-14, for a little getaway to Chicago. We drove in so I have no advice about the airport distance. The hotel is nice, the rooms are very modern. Very comfortable beds & a nice shower. My only complaint for the room was that the light above the sink & vanity was out, we went to report it only to see a note that due to a manufaturer defect that all the lights above the bathroom vanity were out. Not a terribly big deal, but it does make putting on makeup a little harder & it was the only mirror in the entire room. So ladies if you stay here I'd just suggest you bring an extra mirror so you can use it where there is more light. Parking was validated through the front desk each day & the hotel charged us $18 to park per day. They had a little food nook so to speak across from the front desk, but we never patronized it. From the looks of it though they offered both hot & cold items, fruit etc but nothing complimentary. The room contains the basics iron, ironing board & fridge, no microwave, but there was one downstairs in the nook. The fridge had 2 complimentary bottles of water. The staff was very nice & helpful when we had questions. The hotel is very close to a convention center (there was a Comicon convention there the same weekend we were there) it looks to be in walking distance. The hotel is also very close to highway I90. There was construction in front of the entrance so make sure you turn into the correct lot. A clean modern hotel, all in all the stay was nice & I would stay again, however I'd try to get a cheaper rate.
reviews.title: Very modern & sleek

reviews.text: This is not what you'd expect from a W affiliated hotel. The windows, pool and carpet were dirty as was the bathroom sink in our room. The rooms are small for hotels in the OHare area.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Chicago and we were looking for a nice hotel near the airport and close to CTA and Metra lines. Well this hotel is located like 10 minutes walking distannce from transport and 10 minutes by car or CTA from O´Hare. The hotel is modern, no stuffy mausoleum type ambiance. Loved the decor and the room was amazingly comfortable and bright and fresh. We loved walking to and from the CTA station, although they offer free shuttle. Rosemont is a very nice, safe, and clean area. There was a Muvico Theater right across a parking garage!!!BIG plus for us movie fans! It was the perfect stay, the staff was so friendly ans helpful, the hotel, the room, the location, the area where it is EVERYTHING was great! I love this hotel and recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Chicago.
reviews.title: Incredible Experience!

description: Conveniently located just minutes away from the airport, the Aloft Chicago O'Hare offers all travelers a new experience with a loft inspired design as well as lounge, 24/7 gym, and indoor pool.
